definition: the Grand Canal, 1800 km from Beijing to Hangzhou, built starting from 486 BC
abbr. for Beijing/surname Jing/Jing ethnic minority
capital city of a country/big/algebraic term for a large number (old)/artificial mound (old)

sentences.english: This is the earliest section of the Beijing-Hangzhou Canal.
sentences.chinese: 这是京杭运河最早建成的一段。

sentences.english: This project is at the southern end of Gongchen Bridge in north Gongshu, which is the south terminal of Jing-Hang Canal.
sentences.chinese: 该项目位于拱墅区北部拱宸桥南，是京杭运河的南端。

sentences.english: I heard that the Beijing-Hangzhou Canal is a wonder in China.
sentences.chinese: 我听说这京杭运河是中国一大奇迹。

sentences.english: There are crisscrossing waterways connected to the old Beijing-Hangzhou Grand Canal.
sentences.chinese: 这里河道纵横交错，与古老的京杭运河相连。

definition: the Grand Canal, 1800 km from Beijing to Hangzhou, built starting from 486 BC
the Grand Canal, 1800 km from Beijing to Hangzhou, built starting from 486 BC
Shaobo Lake, freshwater lake in Jiangsu Province
Huai River, main river of east China, between the Yellow River 黃河|黄河[Huang2 He2] and the Changjiang 長江|长江[Chang2 Jiang1]
Qiantang River that loops around Hangzhou 杭州[Hang2 zhou1] in Zhejiang Province 浙江省[Zhe4 jiang1 Sheng3]
Yongding River to the West of Beijing
